title: sync_test_resources
description: Sync test resources to the local filesystem

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `_viash.yaml`. Path to the _viash.yaml project configuration file.

output.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Path to the directory where the resources will be synced to
output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Path to the directory where the resources will be synced to.

quiet.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Displays the operations that would be performed using the specified command without actually running them
quiet.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Displays the operations that would be performed using the specified command without actually running them.

dryrun.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Does not display the operations performed from the specified command
dryrun.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Does not display the operations performed from the specified command.

delete.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Files that exist in the destination but not in the source are deleted during sync
delete.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Files that exist in the destination but not in the source are deleted during sync.

exclude.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Exclude all files or objects from the command that matches the specified pattern
exclude.help_text: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Exclude all files or objects from the command that matches the specified pattern.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
